required_skills: EnglishAttention to Detail, Communication, IEC 62304, ISO 13485, ISO 14971, Information Security Management, Medical Devices, QSR, and Record Keeping
location: Topcon Healthcare Europe · Oulu, North Ostrobothnia, Finland  3 days ago  · 9 applicants
job_description:
Do you want to have a direct impact on developing the world's leading health technology software? Do you dream of working with products that genuinely improve the quality of life for people across the globe? Great, because we have a job opening for you!What kind of work is this?As a QARA Specialist/Senior Specialist, you will work as a part of the QARA team. You will support our software development project teams and provide guidance on the applicable regulations and standards governing the products in development. You may also support regulatory submissions and product licensing globally. Developing and maintaining the Quality Management System is one of the continuous key tasks for this role.Your role will include the following core duties: Prepare and update technical filesCoordinate the release readinessCollaborate close with product development and product management teamsCommunicate and coordinate with stakeholdersDrive, maintain and improve the CAPA process and guide cross-functional teamsActively participate in/carry out internal auditsEnsure compliance with medical device regulation and standardsUpdate/draft procedures
The position is located in Oulu, offering the flexibility of a hybrid work model, allowing you to work both in the office and remotely. The start date for the position can be arranged flexibly to accommodate your scheduleWhy should I apply for a job at Topcon Healthcare Solutions?You can come here as you are. We appreciate all personality types and truly believe that a good team consists of a wide range of different, unique characters. Our team of over 150 professionals in Finland has a relaxed atmosphere, and we think that a bit of humor makes work a lot easier.You will be involved in a great workplace with a start-up atmosphere. You will sense the enthusiasm and can-do attitude. while our global parent company brings stability and supports our product development and growth. Our team is at the cutting edge of the software and technology industry and is constantly following industry trends.You don’t have to get stuck in your career development, because you’ll have a chance to learn new skills and take on new responsibilities. We are growing fast and you can grow with us to new roles.In return for your input, we offer you salary in the range of 4100 - 5100 euro/month depending on your experience, and benefits such as a lunch benefit, education program, sports, massage and culture vouchers, and leisure-time insurance.What do you expect from me?To succeed in this position, you should have: Relevant Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, e.g., Health Technology and InformaticsExperience and knowledge of regulatory framework in medical devices and demonstrated ability to interpret regulations and make informed decisionsExperience with medical device standards and regulations (MD Directive/Regulation, ISO 13485)Attention to detail in setting, conducting, and documentingRecords keeping in compliance with Company policy and regulatory requirementsExcellent communication skills in English, both written and oral. Finnish is seen as an advantage
We also value: Experience with software as medical deviceWorking knowledge of ISO 14971, IEC 62304 and IEC 62366 and US FDA QSRExperience with ISO/IEC 27001 or other information security management systems is seen as an advantageExperience with cybersecurity in medical devicesExperience in performing internal auditsExperience with medical device registrations
I want this job! What should I do next?If this job excited you and you identified yourself with the description of the person we are looking for, please send your application (including salary request) with your CV to us no later than November 15th and we will see if we would fit together!Candidates are considered on a rolling basis, and we will contact each applicant personally by email. If you want to talk about the task in more detail, please contact our hiring manager Anita Jansen (+358 40 564 9883) on November 2nd between 11:00 - 12:00 or on November 09th between 11:30-12:30 (Finnish time).Who is Topcon?  Topcon Healthcare sees eye health differently. Our vision is to empower providers with smart, value-driven and efficient technologies for enhanced care. Keeping pace with the ever-changing landscape of the healthcare industry, Topcon Healthcare offers the latest integrated solutions, including advanced multimodal imaging, vendor-neutral data management and ground-breaking remote diagnostic technology.Topcon Healthcare Solutions is part of Topcon Corporation. We specialize in providing modern software solutions for eye care. Our primary target is to offer the whole workflow from the clinical device connection to archiving and telemedicine. Our solutions have been designed in cooperation with physicians and other healthcare professionals to provide excellent usability and performance. Our customers are optical retailers, clinics and hospitals.

required_skills: Data Analytics and Data WarehousingData Architecture, Data Lakes, Data Modeling, Data Strategies, Enterprise Data, Envisioning, Snowflake, and Snowflake Cloud
location: Nortal · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · 24 applicants
job_description:
OverviewDo you enjoy being a part of the data revolution and constantly look for new solutions ? Do you want to join an agile, international company and help businesses in different industries to innovate in the data arena, create new opportunities and bring their operations to a whole new level?We are now looking for an experienced Azure Data Architect, with  strong   technical background, who is ready to be an essential part of Nortal’s growth in data competence. We are building a Data and IoT Center of Excellence in Finland, so now is a perfect time to join and contribute to the development of the new CoE . You will get to work side-by-side with our experts in data and IoT development in Finland , closely collaborating with our data and software delivery teams around the globe .ResponsibilitiesYour role involves identifying the data needs of the customer, and designing and maintaining the master blueprints to meet those needs . You build data architectures, guide data integration and data modeling , control data assets, and align data investments with the customer’s strategy.You will at the same time be setting up the standards for data related offering, services, and architecture across Nortal Finland. You are proactive in seeking new ways of working in the data arena, but you are never alone , as the team loves to support one another and bounce ideas. You enjoy communicating with different stakeholders and network easily. You embrace leading people by example and enjoy hands-on work to make an impact.Nortal ’s offices are located in Helsinki, Turku, Oulu, Uusikaupunki and, Jyväskylä. This position can be worked from any of the previous, but we are pretty flexible with remote work as well.QualificationsYou are likely to succeed if you have: Experience in envisioning and designing solid data architectures as part of overall enterprise architectureHave background in software engineeringStrong working experience on enterprise data strategies and data warehouse solutionsExperience in various types of data architectures like data lakes, data warehouse and lakehousesUp-to-date understanding of the data mesh paradigmExperience in Azure and on-premise data solutionsAre familiar with Snowflake and DatabricksLove to innovate, demonstrate thought leadership and enjoy supporting pre-sales as a solution architectOne of following Microsoft certificates: Azure Solutions Architect Expert, Azure Data Engineer Associate, Azure Database Administrator AssociateAre fluent in both Finnish and English
Additionally It Is Beneficial If You Have work experience on data infrastructures and networking
On top of everything else, here are a few other perks why to join Nortal. We are waiting for you! 😊 Flexible working in general; flexible hours, working either at our office downtown or remotely when you like.We even have a nomad program that enables you to work from almost anywhere in the world for up to three months!Nice benefits such as support for learning (free digital library, opportunities for mentoring, participating in courses, support for gaining certificates etc.), massage, holiday apartment in Northern FinlandGreat colleagues to have lunch with, sing karaoke, go walking in the forest or even try archery. You are more than welcome to suggest any fun activities to do together!
Interested?Apply here or contact our recruiter Nina directly at nina.nevalainen(at)nortal.com

required_skills: Analytical SkillsAgile Project Management, Business Requirements, Communication, Conflict Resolution, Data Modeling, Gap Analysis, Strategic Thinking, Test Cases, and User Acceptance Testing
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 weeks ago  · 20 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19860  Do you have a can-do attitude and are you ready to take the next step as a Technical Business Analyst in Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations and Analytics? Would you like to learn and develop your experience of projects related to financial crime? We have a unique and exciting opportunity for a Technical Business Analyst within Nordea’s Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA) department. Working with us, you will play a part in building a better bank that fulfils a meaningful role in society. We aim to help our 11 million customers around the world improve their lives and reach their goals. To protect our customers and society, we dedicate our best minds and latest technologies to stop money laundering, financing of terrorism, bribery and corruption and other financial crimes by denying the criminals access to the banking system. Our scope is international, as we are the leading bank in the Nordic region with activities around the world, and we must be always up to date on the lookout for new threats and proactive responses. The task is exciting and intellectually rewarding. Are you up to the challenge? At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company, with a chance to make your mark on something bigger. About this opportunity This is a role within the Investigation, Intelligence & Analytics area of Financial Crime prevention (FCIIA) with the responsibility of facilitating both operational and strategic intelligence development, as well as cross jurisdictional special investigations. As the Technical Business Analyst, you will play a valuable role in the agile team dedicated to deliver quality risk indicators to help establishing an outstanding financial crime compliance organisation. As the Technical Business Analyst, you will be the bridge between business needs and the technical solution.What you will be doing: Work with business stakeholders to be aware of their overall strategies/objectives to be able to offer/deliver relevant products to facilitate those strategiesUnderstand the requirements of business stakeholders and convert them into high quality productsDocument the business requirement and functional/technical solution to create the final product with necessary data test cases as well as user acceptance test casesCommunicate requirements and technical solutions to both business and IT stakeholdersEngage and collaborate with delivery partners to develop and implement data productsConduct data tests and user acceptance testsTake responsibility for the final product delivery with technically feasible solutionsConduct gap analysis to identify areas for improvement in existing systems and processesProvide support during the deployment phases of project
 You will join a team with a high focus on Financial Crime prevention covering investigations, intelligence,  and analytics. The role is based in the either Sweden, Finland or Estonia. Who you are Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. Your experience and background: Academic degree, preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or applicableExperience in working closely with business stakeholders as well as IT stakeholdersHands on experience in analysis including data modelling, source to target mapping, test case definition and data testing/UATUsed to being the key person between business and IT stakeholders and resolve conflicts whereas it is necessary6+ years of relevant work experienceHands on experience in SQL / MySQLHave the ability to explain technical concepts in a business-friendly mannerHave the ability to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environmentStrategic thinking and the ability to align the solution with overall strategic goalsHave proficiency in English, both spoken and written (professional level)
 Nice to have: Hands on experience on HadoopExperience in Scala, PythonKnowledge of banking business/products and experience on financial crime Experience in agile project management principles Experience in Power BI
 If it sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 03/11/2023. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.  For more information, you’re welcome to contact Pinar Akturk Oralm at pinar.akturk.oral@nordea.com.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. We kindly ask you to submit your CV and cover letter in English.

location: Baleen Labs Ltd. · European Economic Area  5 hours ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
The Eclipse 550 is the most fuel-efficient twin-engine jet on the planet and features best-in-class performance, economics, and safety. You will be working with our newly-established data team to build statistical and simulation models to allow the senior leadership team to make data-driven decisions to meet the company’s three very clear strategic priorities. A background in mechanical engineering, aerospace or similar is essential for this role.This is a fully remote working role, so you will need to be a proactive worker, able to work well with minimal management and a self-starter. There is scope for you to work in our HQ in Reading, UK if desired.Whilst there are no‘fixed working hours’, our data team is based in Europe and our client is on US Mountain Time so you will be required to be available for remote meetings in these time zones. Some travel might be required and so you must be eligible to travel to the USA.We’re looking for someone with: Experience of data science, machine learning, advanced analytics experience in aviation, aerospace or similar sectorsA degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Maths, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, Operational Research or Engineering)Knowledge of avionics and aerospace-related datasetsExperience in building, deploying, testing and maintaining Machine Learning (ML) solutions and working with MLOps tools and engineering production ML pipelinesExperience with multiple statistical data analysis and machine learning methods such as generalised linear regression, regression and classification trees, unsupervised learning methods, causal inference, stochastic processes, time series forecastingExperience with latent variable models (desirable, not essential)Experience in applying Data Science / ML in production to build data-driven products for solving business problemsExperience in designing experiments to generate data and gain insights into the engineering performanceCoding skills in general purpose languages like Scala or Python, and familiarity with software engineering principles around testing, code reviews and deploymentProficient in data analysis and visualisation using tools like R and PythonProficiency in SQL
Additionally, due to the nature of the business, we expect background checks may need to be undertaken on candidates to ensure that they are eligible to work under the various treaties and controls.Our CultureAt Baleen Labs, we adopt a people first culture. We have a very flexible way of working. Our employees are able to work whenever and wherever they feel the most productive, whether that is in our offices in Reading or on the beach in the Bahamas (so long as you have a strong internet connection!) Our clients are in many different time zones and so long as you are available for required meetings and work is completed by the deadlines, how you work and when you work is up to you.We encourage all of our employees to develop their knowledge however they would like and facilitate any useful expansion of their knowledge with courses, mentoring and conferences.Benefits vary by location but typically include: 25 days holidayGenerous pension schemePrivate healthcareDiscretionary bonusMany opportunities for development and training
Interview Process Initial interview with the CEO and CTOTechnical interview with CTO and Data Scientist to go through candidates technical skillsPotential follow up interview with CEO and CTO for any additional questions

required_skills: Data Engineering, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), and SQLAzure Data Lake, Azure Databricks, Data Architecture, Data Governance, Data Lakes, Data Modeling, and Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA)
location: CGI · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 day ago  · 2 applicants
job_description:
Position DescriptionVuonna 1976 perustettu CGI on maailman ja Suomen suurimpia IT- ja liiketoimintakonsultoinnin palveluyhtiöitä – ja tuhansien erilaisten uratarinoiden talo. Lisätietoa www.cgi.fi.Data Architect, Digital SocietyHaluatko työskennellä kehittyvässä ympäristössä, jossa mielenkiintoiset ongelmanratkaisutilanteet ovat arkipäivää? Jos vastasit kyllä, paikkasi voisi olla tiimissämme!Tässä tehtävässäData Arkkitehdin tehtävässä voit olla esimerkiksi toteuttamassa asiakkaamme modernia tietovarastoa pilveen tai rakentamassa integraatioita. Kanssamme voit vaikuttaa oman työsi sisältöön, ja meille on tärkeää, että pääset työskentelemään ja kehittymään sinua kiinnostavien teknologioiden parissa. Työssäsi autat suomalaisia sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon toimijoita sekä kuntasektoria kehittämään liiketoimintaansa datan avulla.Tiimi, johon tuletDigital Society -yksikkömme palvelee sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon sekä kunta toimialojen asiakkaista. Tiimimme tuo yhteen tietojenkäsittelyn ja toimialojen substanssin parhaan osaamisen. Tiimin ydinosaamista ovat data-analytiikan ja tiedolla johtamisen asiantuntijapalvelut sekä konsultointipalvelut, jotka yhdistämme CGI:n laajaan tarjontaan mm. palvelumuotoilusta, tietoturvasta ja ohjelmistokehityksestä. Kun tiimimme asiantuntijat laittavat fiksut päänsä yhteen, osaamme esimerkiksi toimittaa modernin, pilvipalveluita hyödyntävän data-alustan niin hyvinvointialueiden tarpeisiin. Meillä jokaisen asiantuntijuudelle on oma paikkansa, kanssamme viihdyt varmasti!Tuleva toimistosi voi olla millä tahansa Suomen toimipisteestämme. Jos kotitoimisto on enemmän mieleesi, sekin sopii meille. Joustavan hybridityön avulla haluamme mahdollistaa, että työsi ja vapaa-aikasi pysyvät tasapainossa.Näin onnistut kanssammeSinulla on jo kokemusta pilvipohjaisten datatyökalujen kanssa työskentelystä, erityisesti tietovarastoinnissa. Teemme paljon yhteistyötä sekä tiimin sisällä että asiakkaiden kanssa, joten toivomme sinulta hyviä vuorovaikutustaitoja, niin suomeksi kuin englanniksi. Ennen kaikkea arvostamme positiivista asennetta ja oma-aloitteisuutta. Toivoisimme sinulta osaamista seuraavista:  Azure Data Lake Azure Databricks Azure Synapse Analytics SQL
Tiimimme työskentelee muun muassa seuraavien teknologioiden parissa, ja eduksi katsomme, jos sinulta löytyy osaamista seuraavista:  Pilvipohjaiset data-alustat, kuten Synapse ja Snowflake Agile Data Engine MS PowerBI, Tableau Azure Integration Services, DataFactory Python WhereScape Ellie
Todennäköisesti sinulta löytyy etsimäämme osaamista, mikäli ainakin osa yllä mainituista on sinulle tuttuja (ja mieluisia) teknologioita ja pystyt hyödyntämään niitä tekemisessä täysimääräisesti ja kokonaisuuksien kannalta mielekkäällä tavalla.Jos olet ongelmanratkaisija, jolla on intohimoinen suhtautuminen dataan, haluamme kuulla sinusta! Soittele rohkeasti Tuomakselle (yhteystiedot alla) niin keskustellaan yhdessä millaisia uramahdollisuuksia meillä voisi olla tarjolla.Meillä CGI:llä…… olet member.Tarjoamme sinulle paitsi työn, jossa voit kehittyä haluamaasi suuntaan, myös mahdollisuuden omistaa yhtiön osakkeita. Koska yli 80 prosenttia henkilöstöstämme on myös omistajia, kutsumme henkilöstöämme membereiksi. Membereinä pääsemme nauttimaan CGI:n taloudellisesta menestyksestä ja rakentamaan toiveidemme mukaista yhtiötä.… saat olla sellainen kuin olet.Meitä on 3 700 ympäri Suomen ja meille on tärkeää, että jokainen meistä saa olla työpaikalla oma itsensä. Monimuotoiset tiimimme määrittelevät itse, millaiset joustavat työnteon tavat niille parhaiten sopivat. Meillä työ myös joustaa, kun elämäntilanne sitä vaatii.… sinusta pidetään huolta.Meille CGI:n membereille on tärkeää, että tuemme ja autamme aina toisiamme. Et ole koskaan yksin: tuhansista huippuasiantuntijoistamme löytyy aina joku, johon tukeutua. Ja tarjoamme tietysti myös laajan valikoiman henkilöstöetuja, jotka auttavat sinua voimaan paremmin.… innostut työstäsi – yhä uudelleen.Meillä viihdytään pitkään, koska kokoisessamme talossa on tarjolla aina uusia uramahdollisuuksia ja niihin siirtyminen on tehty helpoksi. Kun kaipaat vaihtelua, voit ottaa haltuun uuden teknologian, toimialan tai asiakkuuden – ja kun kaipaat työltä joustoa uudessa elämäntilanteessa, sekin järjestyy. Tule meille rakentamaan itsesi näköinen ura!Kiinnostuitko?Mahtavaa, mekin kuulisimme mielellämme lisää sinusta! Mikäli jokin jäi mietityttämään, antaa tuleva esihenkilösi Tuomas Hujala mielellään lisätietoa tehtävästä ja tiimistä. Our motivated and supportive team is eager to start working with you.We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Customer Insights, Data and Analytics team at Trimble Solutions Corporation in Espoo, Finland. Our team is responsible for data & analytics, data driven culture, processes and tools within the Structures Division and building and managing a centralized data platform.We are proud of enabling our organization to deliver customer value and make better decisions through the analytics and insights we provide. We hope you share our passion for data and are eager to apply your expertise to help productionize solutions that leverage our data.What You Will Do Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for our central customer data platformDevelop data models and ETL processes that optimize data delivery for different purposes (analytics, AI, APIs etc.)Monitor and optimize data performance and ensure data infrastructure meets business needsEnforce data governance to ensure data quality and accuracyCollaborate with stakeholders across different teams to ensure data delivery

job_title: Helsinki Associate Program - Privacy (Cyber & Digital Risk)
required_skills: Communication, Organization Skills, and Problem Solving
location: Advisense · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 week ago  · 42 applicants
job_description:
We are looking for a new colleague in our Privacy team, as part of Cyber & Digital Risk in the Helsinki Office. We are a group of specialists in privacy and cyber security working with clients from different industries to support them in building trust by protecting personal data. We focus on each customer’s needs, making privacy a natural part of our customer's core business. About The Associate ProgramJoining our Associate Program is an opportunity to work with our clients and broaden your understanding of data protection in changing and complex regulatory environments. The program provides a unique opportunity to grow your professional network, build essential skills, and gain valuable insights. The program is designed to be both challenging and rewarding, allowing you to launch your career with a steep learning curve.Your Background And Experience Graduates with a relevant educational background and a keen interest in learning about privacy and data security in different industries. The main thing is a genuine interest in privacy and a proactive attitude. Up to two years of work experience after graduation or otherwise interested in joining the Associate Program to become a privacy professional or grow.Problem-solving skills to help our clients balance risks and identify opportunities in the digital space.Capability to work in English and Finnish. Any other language skill, especially Swedish, is considered an advantage.
TraitsWe are searching for individuals who are passionate about their work, committed to making a positive impact, and genuinely driven to help our customers succeed.You possess a thirst for knowledge and are dedicated to sharing your expertise with both customers and colleagues, while continuously expanding and deepening your understanding. You prioritize agile work processes and appreciate a culture that allows for quick and efficient problem-solving. You treat others, including our customers and society, with kindness and respect. We collaborate as a team, supporting, empowering, and challenging each other while building lasting relationships.Additional InformationAt Advisense, we strive to create an inclusive workplace, and as such, we have a strong focus on diversity and equality. We care about each other and invest in our employees' development to maximize the potential and performance of every consultant. Advisense's organization is informal with an open-door policy, and we value work-life balance for our employees.We encourage you to take action and apply for our job openings promptly. If the job listing is still visible, it means the position is still available for you. Please note that we don't accept applications via email.Our selection procedure for the Associate Program is designed to bring out the best in you. It includes a psychological evaluation (approx. 20 minutes to complete), interviews and reference check. We consider that it is essential for candidates to feel engaged throughout the entire process. Therefore, we will keep you updated throughout the process and are always available to answer any questions along the way.
 
 
About The Associate Program
Your Background And Experience
Graduates with a relevant educational background and a keen interest in learning about privacy and data security in different industries. The main thing is a genuine interest in privacy and a proactive attitude. Up to two years of work experience after graduation or otherwise interested in joining the Associate Program to become a privacy professional or grow.Problem-solving skills to help our clients balance risks and identify opportunities in the digital space.Capability to work in English and Finnish. Any other language skill, especially Swedish, is considered an advantage.

required_skills: Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science, and Digital Marketing ChannelsBusiness Analytics, Communication, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Automation, and Web Analytics
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · 48 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19131 Would you like to work at one of the most skilled and ambitious data units in the Nordics as well as learn how to master some of the most advanced marketing technologies available on the market? We are now looking for a Digital Analytics Specialist, with a focus on data activation, who can help us on our journey to become the bank that delivers the best customer experience, across all our online and offline channels. At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. About this opportunity Welcome to the Web Analytics & Online Optimization team. We add value by supporting business units across all of the Nordics with a wide range of tasks related to data collection, analytics and data activation for marketing activities. We strive to become the bank that creates the best omnichannel experience for our customers. In achieving this, we need a skilled person to orchestrate data and technologies to help serve relevant and targeted communication through a wide range of marketing channels. As a Digital Analytics Specialist focused on Activation, you will play a valuable role in helping us become more efficient and effective with our relevance to customers, through our applied marketing channels, as well as increase the total number of targeted activities across the entire group.What you’ll be doing: Contribute to the overall data activation strategy and help identify valuable data points and marketing channels/destinations that will enhance the overall segmentation capabilitiesDrive data activation use cases across countries, business units, product areas & marketing channels. Responsible for building and maintaining high-quality audiences for targeted marketing activities like website personalization, marketing automation and programmatic/social buying.Keep oversight of the audiences catalogue and make sure that a proper structure, data governance and privacy preferences are enforced at all times. Help build and improve on internal capabilities for data activation and audience management, e.g. by enabling and educating business stakeholders in the activation of relevant data (Web-and CRM) through the applied Ad- and MarTech platforms. 
 You will join a highly skilled team of specialist who are relentlessly passionate about data and technologies, and who are always seeking new ways to improve and drive real value for our customers. The role is based in Helsinki, Finland.Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. To succeed in this role, we believe that you have: A desire to work with large amounts of data and a talent for identifying data elements that has the potential to bring additional value to business.An open mindset that is good at navigating in a landscape that is constantly changing.An intrinsic drive to constantly make things better and more efficient.An internal go-to-person for questions related to audiences, data and platforms (Mar-/AdTech).Are passionate and relentlessly focused on challenging the status quo and improve/refine on own skill-set. 
Your experience and background:  Proven experience driving data activation projects for marketing campaigns/automation tracks - preferably as in-house specialist or in an agency capacity. Practitioners experience one or more digital marketing channels in a multi-channel marketing setup (Internal and/or external channels).Well versed within marketing technologies – preferably with experience with the Adobe tech stack (or comparable cloud based marketing technologies). Experience working with technologies like DSPs, DMP/CDPs and Campaign Tracking platforms. Knowledge about how to manage data collection (e.g. through a TMS) is preferred .Experience working with and communicating to multiple stakeholders with different capabilities and backgrounds. Strong analytics skills and a data-driven approach with solid commercial experience.Demonstrated ability to learn new skills and pick up new technologies quickly.Fluent in Finnish and English, both verbal and written
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 09/11/2023.  For more information, you’re welcome to contact Nikolaj Bardram, nikolaj.bardram@nordea.com or Jesper Baastrup Hjort, jesper.baastrup.hjort@nordea.com.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 
Job ID: 19131

What you’ll be doing:
Contribute to the overall data activation strategy and help identify valuable data points and marketing channels/destinations that will enhance the overall segmentation capabilitiesDrive data activation use cases across countries, business units, product areas & marketing channels. required_skills: Analytical Skills, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Management, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Data Visualization, DataStage, Embedded SIM (eSIM), Problem Solving, and SAS (Software)
location: OP Financial Group · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
Haemme Pohjola Vakuutuksen Korvauspalveluihin Data Analystia vakituiseen työsuhteeseen tukemaan liiketoiminnan kehittämistä ja päätöksentekoa raportoinnin ja analytiikan keinoin. Kanssamme pääset hyödyntämään merkittävää tietopääomaa ja laajentamaan osaamistasi vahinkovakuuttamisen sekä erityisesti korvauspalveluiden alueella.Data Analyst, Pohjola Vakuutuksen Korvauspalvelut Ensisijainen tehtäväsi Data Analyst -tehtävässä on edistää ja kehittää Korvauspalveluiden data- ja analytiikkakyvykkyyttä siten, että ne palvelevat liiketoiminnan tuloksellista johtamista. Analysoit ja visualisoit dataa tuottaen tietoa ja näkemystä liiketoiminnalle laadukkaan datan ja numeerisen analyysin kautta. Hallitset suuria datakokonaisuuksia, yhdistät dataa eri tietolähteistä sekä visualisoit ja konkretisoit havaintosi loppukäyttäjälle ymmärrettävään ja helposti hyödynnettävään muotoon.Olemassa olevan datan hyödyntämisen lisäksi tehtäviisi kuuluu myös kehittää dataympäristön laatua, sisältöä ja prosesseja sekä näihin liittyviä menetelmiä ja työkaluja yhdessä tiimisi ja sidosryhmien kanssa. Varmistat osaltasi, että korvauspalveluilla on käytössään kattavat ja tehokkaat analytiikka- ja raportointivälineet päivittäisen johtamisen ja uudistumisen mahdollistajina, sekä koulutat tarvittaessa liiketoiminnallisia tiimejä datan hyödyntämisessä.Tarkemmin tulevasta toimintaympäristöstäsiTehtävässä toimit osana Korvauspalveluiden Yhteiset kyvykkyydet -organisaatiota, joka tarjoaa vahvan tuen yhtenäisten vahinkoasioinnin prosessien ja digitaalisten palveluiden sekä työkalujen ja osaamisen kehittämisessä. Oman roolisi keskiössä on Korvauspalveluiden datan hyödyntäminen sekä sisällön ja laadun kehittäminen yhteistyössä Korvauspalveluiden johdon, asiantuntijoiden sekä Pohjola Vakuutuksen tietoarkkitehtuurin kehittäjien kanssa. Olet siis keskeisessä roolissa vaikuttamassa siihen, kuinka hyödynnämme parhaiten dataa mm. asiakaskokemuksen parantamiseksi sekä laadun ja tehokkuuden lisäämiseksi eri prosesseissa.… ja siitä, miksi tähän tilaisuuteen kannattaa tarttuaKetterän toimintatapamme myötä meillä luotetaan asiantuntijoihimme sekä kannustetaan tekemään rohkeita päätöksiä, ja odotamme myös sinun laittavan asiantuntijuutesi peliin ja kehittävän aktiivisesti toimintaamme. Tarjoammekin sinulle vastuullisen ja vaihtelevan tehtävän alueella, jonka merkitys liiketoiminnassa on keskeinen ja kasvaa jatkuvasti.Koska elämä on paljon muutakin kuin työtä, meille on ensisijaisen tärkeää, että henkilöstömme voi ja jaksaa hyvin. Pidämme arvossa työn ja vapaa-ajan tasapainoa ja työskentelemme joustavasti hybridityömallilla.Saat käyttöösi monipuoliset henkilöstöetumme, johon kuuluvat henkilöstörahasto sekä henkilökuntaehtoiset pankki-, vakuutus- ja lainapalvelut. Tarjoamme myös kattavan työterveyshuollon, laajan hoitokuluvakuutuksen sekä täysajan tapaturmavakuutuksen. Työssäjaksamiseen panostamme arjen tasapainolla ja joustavuudella sekä tarjoamalla käyttöösi lounas-, liikunta- ja kulttuuriedut sekä mahdollisuuden edulliseen lomailuun OPn lomaosakkeissa.Etsimämme osaajan tuntomerkit Olet aidosti kiinnostunut datasta ja sen hyödyntämisestä liiketoiminnan johtamisessa. Sinulla on kyky tunnistaa ja nähdä olennainen, sekä luovia sujuvasti lukuisten datalähteiden ja erilaisten dataan liittyvien toimeksiantojen parissa. Innostut liiketoiminnan kehittämisestä ja nautit siitä, että pääset tuottamaan reaaliaikaista näkymää ja havaintoja asioiden tilasta analyysin ja ohjelmoinnin keinoin.Arvostamme erityisesti seuraavaa teknistä osaamista Kokemusta liiketoimintalähtöisestä kokonaisvaltaisesta tiedon mallinnuksesta ja datan hyödyntämisestäKokemusta analytiikka- ja raportointityökaluista (esim. SAS, Databricks) tai datan visualisointityökaluista (esim. PowerBI, Tableau)Kokemusta tietokannoista ja ohjelmointikielistä (esim. Python, R, SQL, Spark)Arvostamme lisäksi osaamista ja ymmärrystä pilviympäristöistä (mm. Azure, AWS) sekä tietovarastoinnista ja ETL-ratkaisuista (esim. DataStage, Kafka)
Tulet työskentelemään niin tarkkojen yksityiskohtien kuin laajojen kokonaisuuksienkin parissa, mikä edellyttää sinulta kykyä hahmottaa asioiden välisiä yhteyksiä sekä ratkaisukeskeistä – toisinaan myös luovuutta vaativaa – työskentelyä. Toimit itseohjautuvasti ja vastuullisesti, ja osaat organisoida ja priorisoida työsi. Olet osallistuva tiimipelaaja ja hyödynnät rohkeasti kollegoiden asiantuntemusta ja tukea tarvittaessa. Rakennat tuloksellisesti yhteistyötä myös sidosryhmien kanssa, ja sinulla on erinomaiset vuorovaikutustaidot niin suomeksi kuin englanniksi.Miten tästä eteenpäin?Jos sinulla on mielessä kysymyksiä tehtävästä tai meillä työskentelystä, niin ota yhteyttä johtaja Seppo Turuseen (050 520 5802 tai seppo.turunen(a)pohjola.fi) 3.11.2023 klo 1300 – 1500 tai 7.11.2023 1500 – 1600 tai Lead Business Data Analyst Saku Saloon (050 4090846 tai saku.salo(a)pohjola.fi) 9.11.2023 1100 – 1400 tai 13.11.2023 1100-1300.Jos taas vakuutimme sinut jo siitä, että tätä mahdollisuutta ei kannata jättää väliin, voit hakea tehtävään 19.11.2023 mennessä oheisen linkin kautta.Finanssialalla luottamus ja vastuullisuus ovat toimintamme perusta, minkä vuoksi tehtävään valittavalle henkilölle tehdään tarvittavat tehtäväkohtaiset taustaselvitykset.OP Ryhmä on yhdenvertaisuutta ja monimuotoisuutta arvostava työyhteisö. Kannustamme kaikenlaisia henkilöitä hakemaan meille töihin ja toivotamme tervetulleiksi kaikki sukupuoli-identiteetit, eri-ikäiset sekä kulttuuri- ja vähemmistöryhmät.OP Ryhmä on Suomen suurin finanssiryhmä. Olemme asiakkaidemme omistama, yksi finanssialan houkuttelevimmista työnantajista Suomessa. Ryhmässämme työskentelee yli 13 000 alan ammattilaista, ja tuotamme sekä kehitämme pankki-, sijoitus-, vakuutus- ja kiinteistönvälityspalveluita neljälle miljoonalle asiakkaallemme. Lisätietoa OPsta työnantajana ja kaikki avoimet tehtävämme löydät osoitteesta www.op-careers.fi.

required_skills: Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Warehousing, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)Apache Kafka, Cassandra, Communication, and Problem Solving
location: Schibsted Finland · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  21 hours ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELLYou? A data engineer with interest in Data Mesh who is passionate about building high quality software and infrastructure and loves collaborating with others.Role? We are currently seeking a full-time Data Engineer with interest in Data Mesh for the Schibsted Data Enablement and Infrastructure team.Tech stack? Some examples of our tech stack consists of Terraform, Kafka, Github Actions, KubernetesLocation? You can apply to work at one of our hubs in Aarhus or Helsinki. Most of us work some days from home a couple of days a week and love meeting our colleagues weekly for collaboration. If you like, you can of course work from the office every day.Company? Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland, Blocket in Sweden and FINN.no in Norway recently joined forces, now collectively forming Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Together, we serve over 325 million monthly visits. Our technology unit is instrumental to our success story, deploying new code to production over 1800 times per week.Why us? You will be joining a dynamic and innovative team that will lead the data mesh strategy for all the marketplaces in the Nordics. You will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact for other developers and make systems that are used by millions of people.Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!WHO ARE YOU?You are passionate about building high quality software and infrastructure, enjoy sharing knowledge , and making a difference together with others. You have a genuine interest in our products and the needs of our end-users, and you always consider what’s best for the company when making technology decisions. When you see something that needs to be done, you step up and do it. You are curious and driven to develop your skills to solve problems.Additionally, you have: Good understanding of the principles of Data Mesh. Knowledge of Java and the JVM platform BSc or MSc degree and at least three years of experience within IT Experience with any of the following or similar is an advantage: Kafka, Kotlin, GCP, AWS, Git, Kubernetes, Spring,, PostgreSQL, Cassandra Experience working in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban etc) A high degree of effective, proactive communication skills in English, both verbally and in written form. 
WHO ARE WE?Join our innovative Data Platform team! We're on an exciting journey towards Data Mesh, fostering shared, reliable, and secure data. As a team member, you'll collaborate closely with other Nordic Marketplaces teams, crafting custom vertical solutions and creating decentralized data products through our centralized Event Stream. We value teamwork, continuous improvement, and a flexible workday that puts the "Team first." Be part of our tight-knit community, learn from each other, and help shape the world's best marketplace.GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by November 19th. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.QUESTIONS?Engineering Manager Lotte Johansen is happy to tell you about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. Lotte is best available at LinkedIn, or email (lotte.johansen[at]schibsted.com).

required_skills: Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Warehousing, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Apache Kafka, Azure Databricks, Data Flow, Data Lakes, Data Modeling, and English as a Second Language (ESL)
location: OP Financial Group · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 33 applicants
job_description:
Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey into the heart of data transformation in one of Finland’s largest financial institutions? OP Life Insurance is now on the lookout for an accomplished Data Engineer to join our dynamic and growing team in Vallila, Helsinki!What is your future role like?We are currently seeking an experienced data professional to fill the role of Data Engineer and join our growing numbers at OP Life Insurance! At OP, we are making significant investments in enhancing our data capabilities to align with our business strategy. Our focus is on fostering data-driven decision-making and pushing forward the fundamental pillars of our data vision growth, customer experience, and efficiency. We are driving this progress through the application of data and analytics use cases. We are currently in the process of transitioning from on-premises systems to a cloud-based platform, and we're offering you the chance to be a part of this transformation and work with cutting-edge technologies.In your day-to-day work, you will play a crucial role in our ongoing platform transformation, which will support our future business needs. In this renewal, we are transforming our insurance business into a new Guidewire Insurance Suite platform. Thanks to this transformation, in the future we are going to be able to handle insurance, billing & collections and claims all in one platform!Furthermore, as a Data Engineer in OP Life Insurance you will get to work in our risk life renewal program and its data integration team. Your role will include technical data integration, covering both operational integrations and the utilization of operational analytics. In this role, you will have excellent opportunities for continuous professional development and learning from multi-skilled colleagues while simultaneously bringing your own expertise to the table.The opportunity is available in Helsinki and like the rest of OP, we work in a flexible manner, combining both office days and remote work. What we hope from you? Our recruitment is not meant to seem like a puzzle, so we strive to tell you as clearly as possible what kind of expertise we believe is crucial to thriving in this role. Foremost we hope that you are someone with experience with Data Engineering work and thrive to continuously learn more!Here are some of the requirements and technologies you will work with include Experience in Data Engineering, Data Lake, Data Analytics, ETL, ELT, Data Warehouse, Data ModellingUnderstanding of end-to-end Data flow (from difference source systems to Data Lake subsequently different downstream applications for different use cases)Spark/Scala, PythonExperience in processing streaming data ex. reading data from Kafka topicsExperience in DataBricks or Similar ETL/Analytics Platform in cloud AWS-S3Azure
We understand that you might not have experience in all these areas just yet, but what really matters is your motivation and willingness to learn and grow. At OP Life, we also highly value the ability to work effectively within a team and, when needed, the ability to step up and take leadership in projects. Demonstrating initiative, strong teamwork skills, and a positive attitude are essential attributes we seek. We also hope you are able to communicate clearly and understandably in English and/or Finnish, as effective communication is vital for successful collaboration within our diverse team.What We Offer To help counterbalance work where you are expected to take a lot of responsibility, we seek to ensure employee wellbeing and to enable forward-looking work arrangements. We offer a stable working environment where you can contribute to our core values responsibility, people first and succeeding together. You will enjoy a wide range of staff benefits, including a personnel fund and special terms for employee banking, insurance and loan services. We offer comprehensive occupational health care, extensive medical treatment expenses insurance and a full-time group accident insurance policy. Furthermore, we invest in wellbeing at work by encouraging a good work-life balance, providing flexibility in your daily life, and offering lunch, sport and cultural benefits and opportunities for affordable holidays in OP timeshares. We also encourage and help you to further develop yourself as a technical professional. We have the so called “70/20/10 rule” in use, which means you will use 70% of your time for your daily tasks, 20% to develop the way you do those tasks, and the last 10% is reserved for you to learn and try new things. You will also have our OP Software Academy at your disposal in case you are interested in learning new technologies or methodologies, or why not in honing your skills in your current stack. Sounds like your future role? Great – that’s what we were hoping for! The application period is open until Sunday 12.11.2023. Any questions in mind?Our Tech Lead Abhishek Dutta (tel. +358 50 410 4235) will be happy to answer your questions. You can reach Abhishek best on the following dates and times Thursday, November 2nd, from 2 PM to 3 PM and Friday, November 3rd, from 2 PM to 3 PM. Talk to you soon future colleague! In the financial sector, our business is founded on trust and accountability, which is why the successful candidate will be checked for credit history and corporate connections, must take a drug test and a security clearance vetting made by the Finnish Security and Intelligence Service. Equality and diversity are highly valued at OP Financial Group. We welcome job applications from people of all kinds, regardless of their gender identity or age, or the culture or minority group with which they identify. OP Financial Group is the leading financial services group in Finland. Owned by our customers, we are one of the most alluring employers in the Financial sector. OP Financial Group employs over 13,000 professionals and provides banking, asset management, wealth management, insurance and brokerage services for our four million customers. For more information about OP as an employer and for all vacancies, go to www.op-careers.fi

required_skills: Data Management and EnglishCommunication, Data Governance, Data Quality, Documentation, Metadata, Metadata Management, Nordic Countries, and Processes Development
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 day ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19646 Would you like to be a part of defining meaning of data, improving its searchability and interoperability as levers for effective data management? We are now looking for a Data Steward to continuously support in securing high quality metadata capabilities. At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  About this opportunityWelcome to the Data Governance & Metadata Management team. We add value by exercising a broad range of responsibilities including definition and maintenance of policies and operating models, coordination and advisory, and metadata management.  As the Data Steward, you’ll play a valuable role in safeguarding that our metadata management services, used by business and IT across the bank, are continuously improved and add value for Nordea.What you’ll be doing: Develop and implement efficient and effective metadata management processes and operational instructions that support to continuously maintain high meta data quality Hands-on support to the metadata owners and users by managing metadata in the services Support the development, as well as provisioning of relevant trainingListen carefully for new development ideas As a member of DG&MM team you will also have opportunities to contribute and collaborate broadly across our area of responsibility
 What we offerYou’ll join a dynamic team where we all have a role as organizational change ambassadors, supporting the alignment and implementation of the DG Framework i.e. people, processes and technology coming to place in a good way. This will provide you excellent possibilities to learn and grow professionally. We are implementing a Hybrid working model with added flexibility for remote work. As we are a part of an international organisation, English is our main working language. The role is based in Helsinki (Finland), Stockholm (Sweden) or Gdynia (Poland).  Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. To succeed in this role, we believe that you: Are passionate about business meaning of data and its role in enabling world class financial servicesIt would be perfect if you’ve worked with metadata in some context, particularly in financial industry, but we’re above all observing your persistency to every day achieve high quality results, eagerness to learn more and solid ability to communicate with a service-minded attitudeAre proactively proposing new ideas, approaches and insights, and you continuously seek opportunities for organisational improvement Are able to work independently while you’re a true team-playerHave a positive can-do attitude, always curious and not hesitating to ask questions
 Your experience and background:  Previous work experience in controlling/reporting and projects as e.g. analyst, specialistExperience in process documentation or process developmentYou have professional level fluency, both written and spoken, in English language. Proficiency in Nordic languages is a definite advantageExperience within IBM InfoSphere Suite: Information Governance Catalog, Information Analyzer and Orion Governance is a plusWhile we prefer a university degree in technology or business, the full combination of you is that will matter the most
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 30/11/2023. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Hannu Pertti Tapani Pitkänen at hannu.pitkanen@nordea.com.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. Please note that we will proceed with potential candidates already during the application period. Only for candidates in Sweden - For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.Only for candidates in Poland - Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdfWe reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

required_skills: Big Data, Data Engineering, Data Warehousing, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), and SQLData Architecture, Data Vault, and Parsing
location: Solita · Finland  4 months ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
We are looking for Data Engineers!Solita Connected Data unit in Finland consists of more than 300 data and integration experts. With our growth, we are looking for Data Engineers to work on projects in different industries.What would it be like?Data Engineers work together with Solita team in various customer projects, where data platforms and various data utilisation solutions are built, data storages are modernised and data obtained from IoT sources is processed.You have the possibility to influence what kind of project you want to work on. We want to find you a project that includes learning something new, the possibility to use your existing skills, and creating content that is meaningful to you.What tools are we using?At The Core Of The Data Creation Is Data Processing; Loading, Parsing, Saving, Modelling, And Storing. The Tools Are Selected For Each Project As Needed Almost all of our new data projects are done in the cloud. Our options are AWS, Azure and Google Cloud.Databases create the basis for all data creation. We mostly work with databases that use SQL.Python and other programming languages are actively used, for example, in the construction of data pipes. If you know how to program, you have more options when it comes to our client projects.We want to use modern modelling methods such as Data Vault 2.0.
We expect technological know-how from a Data Engineer, but you don't have to know everything. You get to learn new technologies with us. In addition to tech know-how, we value experience in project work and consulting in the customer interface, but you will learn it by doing. What matters most is your desire to grow your know-how along with the ever-developing IT industry.What else do we offer?We have the muscles of a big company, but the culture of a small company. In practice it means: Opportunities to develop your skills in everyday project work, as well as support in developing your own career path, for example from one role to another (eg. from Data Engineer to Data Architect)Help and sparring from Connected Data community consisting of more than 500 data professionals internationallyA caring culture that promotes a sense of communityTeamwork – in projects we always work as a team, not aloneAppropriate workload so that there is time for other important things in life than work tooFreedom and responsibility – you can do your work wherever you want (at our offices, remotely in Finland, sometimes also at the customer's premises)
What is Solita like as an employer?Solita is an IT consulting company with Finnish roots, and we also have offices in Europe. Our consultants work with Finnish and international projects.In addition to Data Engineers, we also have professionals in data science, data visualisation, and master data, as well as a group of experienced data architects. With our work, we aim to create sustainable solutions – ones that we ourselves would like to use and maintain.Our Values Are Caring, Easy-going, Courage And Passion. Our Employees Have Chosen Those Themselves, And Maybe That's Why We Can See And Feel Value-based Actions Every Day. Here Are a Few Examples Caring: Our culture has been created in a way that you can easily get support in difficult situations from the entire work community, not just from your own project teamEasy-going: Even though we are already quite a large company, the atmosphere is cosy and relaxed, and the hierarchy is low.Courage: We build genuine partnerships with our customers. This sometimes requires courage to disagree with the customer and say it out loud as well.Passion: At Solita, work is done with great passion, but having fun at the same time. We pride ourselves on the quality of our work.
Let's talk?Let's find out together whether we could find the next opportunity in your career with Solita! Our recruitment process includes two interviews, mainly in Teams.Send us your CV or a link to your LinkedIn profile and we will be in touch with you soon. If you want to tell us more about your wishes for the next career opportunity, you may write an application letter too.You may easily contact us via LinkedIn: Vesa Hammarberg (Data Platforms Business Lead) or Anu Päivinen (Talent Acquisition Manager). If you prefer e-mail, our email addresses are of the form firstname.lastname (at) solita.fi.

Almost all of our new data projects are done in the cloud. Our options are AWS, Azure and Google Cloud.Databases create the basis for all data creation. We mostly work with databases that use SQL.Python and other programming languages are actively used, for example, in the construction of data pipes. If you know how to program, you have more options when it comes to our client projects.We want to use modern modelling methods such as Data Vault 2.0.

required_skills: Database Development, DevOps, Full-Stack Development, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), MLOps, Machine Learning, and Software DevelopmentCloud Services and System Development
location: Skyfora · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  3 days ago  · 42 applicants
job_description:
Skyfora helps measure, predict, and adapt to extreme weather caused by climate change with next-generation AI-powered weather intelligence solutions. This enables better preparedness, improved decision-making, and reduced risk for businesses and human lives. We are seeking a Senior Platform Engineer to be part of this exciting journey. Who we are and what we do?Skyfora is at the forefront of weather intelligence, based in Helsinki, Finland. The company has a drive for innovation and a dedication to advance meteorological research. Skyfora proudly leverages AI in improved weather forecasts optimised for industries affected by weather. It also develops state-of-the-art weather instruments and novel patented weather data gathering methods. We are in a very interesting phase of growth with our groundbreaking technology having already achieved great milestones. Our instruments are being used in real hurricanes by the world´s most renowned hurricane researchers and AI Weather Forecasts are used by companies in the sectors of renewable energy and insurance. We have also recently won the EIC Accelerator grant of 2.5 million EUR and are currently growing our core team in Helsinki. Who are we looking for?We are in search of an experienced and hands-on Senior Engineer to help develop our AI Weather Forecast platform and to secure successful delivery of AI Weather Forecast projects. You will have a pivotal role in designing and implementing the platform used for AI Weather Forecasts and customer-specific projects. In our small yet dynamic company, we're looking for someone who is not only enthusiastic staying abreast of industry movements and best practices but also deeply committed to hands-on development. As the team grows this role will have a lot of growth opportunity depending on the applicant´s ambitions. Requirements Proven 5+ years of software and system development experience, ideally within the realm of AI-based products.Demonstrable back-end proficiency with front-/full stack experience being a big bonus.Hand-on experience with leading cloud solutions GCP, AWS, and/or AzureData Lake, Data Warehouse and Database expertise
 Preferred DevOps and, ideally MLOps is considered a strong bonus.Track record of developing a product or platform to market.We work with meteorological data, so having prior experience in either weather data or mathematical modelling would be a significant advantage.
 Why join us? Impact: With us, you get to be part of building pioneering solutions that respond to the operational and humanitarian requirements caused by climate change.Technology: You will have a chance to work with technology that is unique, proprietary, and bleeding edge.Culture: You will be working with a supportive, highly ambitious, yet fun-loving, and entrepreneurial team with minimal bureaucracy. We value the well-being of our staff and a healthy work life balance. We aim to make sure that every team member feels valued and happy in Skyfora.Compensation: Competitive salary with stock options because we want you to be part of our journey.
 If you are passionate about pushing boundaries, exploring uncharted territories, and want to be part of a dynamic team, then this is the place for you. Together, we will continue to redefine what is possible.  Contact details and additional information:For inquiries or to learn more about this opportunity, please reach out to:admin (at) Skyfora.comAdditionally, we have dedicated phone slots available to reach CEO Fredrik Borgström (Tel. +358 40 564 4498) at the following times:  Friday, November 3rd, 2023 from 1 to 4 pmFriday, November 10th, 2023 from 1 to 4 pm
 Please apply the latest by November 15th, 2023. The position may also be filled prior to the latest application date if a suitable candidate is found.

We value the well-being of our staff and a healthy work life balance. We aim to make sure that every team member feels valued and happy in Skyfora.Compensation: Competitive salary with stock options because we want you to be part of our journey.

About HuuvaHuuva Kitchens turn local communities into culinary hotspots by catering the best dishes from the hottest restaurants. With Huuva, there’s always something new that you can mix and match to be delivered to your door with superior convenience and quality.Huuva operates a network of local kitchens that plug into the local and global food scene, making those experiences accessible beyond the most central city locations with always something new to discover. As our dishes are made locally, they also come to you faster. Saving time, money and the environment.Our kitchen technology enables our chefs to focus on the most important thing – the quality and joy of making the best dishes, all curated and cooked by people with a passion for great food and an appetite for what comes next. This is the power of Huuva OS - the most advanced kitchen platform ever created.About The RoleYou will be part of a team focusing on our Back-of-House technology, meaning an operating system that covers all aspects from handling orders across sales channels to inventory management. Data engineering and operative analytics are at the very core of all this as we strive to be the best operator in the industry.As a Data Engineer, you will be the primary owner of our analytics data infrastructure which is built on top of GCP’s BigQuery data warehouse and supported by tools and technologies like DBT Cloud, Hightouch, Airflow, Python and Kafka.What We Expect From YouIn short, we are looking for a candidate with passion for data engineering and enough experience to own and develop our data warehousing and analytics capabilities as the primary owner.Seniority in building data pipelines, data modeling, scripting with Python and the aforementioned tools is expected. Familiarity with data streaming and data visualization is considered as a plus.In addition we expect solid communication and collaboration skills combined with fluency in English, written and spoken.What We Offer Team of talented and easy-going colleaguesA culture of transparency and ownershipFlexible model of work55-70 k€ annual salary and option package

location: Tietoevry · Lappeenranta, South Karelia, Finland Reposted  6 days ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.Tietoevry Tech Services is seeking a highly skilled and dynamic Data Engineer to join our innovative team. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining data solutions that enable our clients to make informed business decisions.We design, build and operate modern cloud-based data management solutions - from source data to data driven tools & applications. We advise our customers to set the direction and data driven transformation focus areas. We support them in creating data strategy, designing overall IT landscape architecture and assessing and developing data related capabilities.We work with cutting edge data related technologies in cloud space including like Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, Spark etc. We are valuable partners with Microsoft and other major BI vendors giving us a great opportunity to learn, grow and apply those technologies in our customer deliveries. We are taking care about data solutions for biggest Nordic companies to help them better understand their customer needs and improve their business.Responsibilities: Design, build, and optimize high-volume batch and real-time data pipelines.Develop and maintain data lake infrastructure, data warehousing, data management platforms and data analytic tools.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and ensure data accuracy and integrity.Implement data governance and security measures.Provide data insights and support to business intelligence (BI) teams.Develop data visualizations to help our customers get the most out of their data.
Requirements: Minimum 2-3 years of relevant work experience in data engineering or a related field.Fluency in both Finnish and English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills.Experience working in modern cloud environments, such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.Solid understanding of data lake infrastructure, data warehousing and data analytic tools.Proven hands-on experience in building high-volume batch and real-time data pipelines.Familiarity with business intelligence tools, preferably MS Power BI.Familiarity with DataOps Management platform solutions, such as ADEStrong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work independently.Experience in data analytics and data visualization tools is highly valuable.Interest for self-development, keeping up with new possibilities and technologies available to help our customers to reach their data goals and beyond. For example through GenAI based solutions.
Location:This position is based in Finland.Employment Type:Full-timeWhat’s in it for you?We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects with the latest technologies, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing and fast developing and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also strongly believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new opportunities emerge.Join us and make your mark!We look forward to your application!Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Juha Anttila via e-mail juha.d.anttila@tietoevry.comHope to hear from you soon!Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.About TietoevryTietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.We create purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good!

required_skills: EnglishAccounting, Communication, Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), German, International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), Microsoft Excel, NetSuite, Stakeholder Management, and VBA Excel
location: Qt Group · Espoo, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  4 hours ago  · 18 applicants
job_description:
We at Qt Group are looking for a Senior Financial Controller to strengthen our Global Finance and Tax Team based in our headquarters in Keilaniemi, Espoo.Qt Group (Nasdaq Helsinki: QTCOM) is a global software company, trusted by industry leaders and over 1.5 million developers worldwide to create applications and smart devices that users love. We help our customers to increase productivity through the entire product development lifecycle - from UI design and software development to quality management and deployment. Our customers are in more than 70 different industries in over 180 countries. Qt Group is headquartered in Espoo, Finland, and employs 700+ people globally. To learn more, visit www.qt.io/. Your work at Qt: Ensuring that our group accounting guidelines are executed appropriately at the subsidiary levelControlling and ensuring the quality of the subsidiaries’ reporting when reports are brought into the consolidation processParticipating in monthly closing processes and preparation of interim and annual consolidated financial statements, including accruals and IFRS adjustmentsPreparing analysis on Qt subsidiaries and the group’s financial informationPreparing individual financial statements and tax returns for entities in Finland as well as withholding tax supporting materials and documentsSupporting in maintaining and updating group IFRS accounting manualsWorking with the other accounting team members and external service providers for the preparation of the subsidiaries’ readiness for future EPR system (NetSuite) implementationOther ad-hoc work as required
In addition to these, you will be working as part of our finance team to compile and analyze data, track information, and support the company in both internal and external stakeholder communication. To learn more about finance and business operations, there are also many opportunities to take on, be it some additional tasks or different projects.We are looking for a motivated team player who enjoys continuous learning and is committed to delivering high-quality results even under a tight schedule.Experience & skills needed to succeed in this role:As a person, you have strong technical accounting skills, work proactively, and communicate openly within your team and across functions. You have a self-driven attitude and willingness to learn and develop as an accounting and reporting specialist, taking ownership of your own responsibility areas.You are a real team player and do not mind working under pressure and uncertainty. You work with an eye for details and accuracy and at the same time understand the big picture and its interrelations. Good knowledge of IFRS and Finnish GAAP, especially about IFRS 15 is needed in this position. Proficiency in Excel is required, and experience with ERPs (e.g., NetSuite) and previous experience in collaborating with various stakeholders (e.g., internal controls and external auditors) is seen as an advantage.You hold a master’s degree in economics with a major in accounting or equivalent and have a few years’ of work experience in a similar role, preferably in a listed company. Good spoken and written Finnish and English skills are required. German is a major benefit.What We Offer Be part of a dynamic, international and fast-growing software company with talented and skilled professionals from all around the worldWide scope of tasks and responsibilities; a chance to learn and develop professionally every dayAn easygoing, experienced and committed team to work withWork-life balance matters: option for a hybrid work-from-home policy and flexible hoursComprehensive occupational health care plan, with health insurance and support for mental wellbeingOther perks such as lunch benefit, yearly wellbeing budget, bike & commuting benefitNice office space in Espoo Keilaniemi, free beverages and fruits, ergonomic equipment, and supportive tools

job_description:
💜 Come work with usNetlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.✨ About usNetlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.💫 What does it mean to be a Data Engineer consultant at Netlight?As a consultant you will be a part of shaping the software products and technical solutions of today and tomorrow alongside your colleagues and clients. Our focus is not only on the digital product, but also on the team dynamics and overall business impact.As a consultant within the data area, you will help our clients in roles such as Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer, Data Architect, Analytics Engineer, to name a few. We work in business-critical projects where we can make the most impact. For example, we setup data platforms with all things included like datawarehousing/Datalake infrastructure & modeling, implemention of ETL/ELT data pipelines in batch or realtime. We design and implement data products including other areas like backend & cloud engineering. We advice and build POCs around new trending topics like data governance, data catalogues or data mesh. We set up cloud environments for data platforms and products.At Netlight, you’ll have the ownership to carve your own career path with the help of our support network. You'll have access to a wide range of clients and roles which are matched based on your personal experience, strengths, interests and market demand.🌱 What makes a successful Data Engineer at Netlight?  Education background in relevant field (Preferred MSc / Minimum BSc)You hold professional experience in relevant technical areas and have an enthusiastic mind-set towards learning new thingsYou have verbal and written fluency in English
You have experience of technologies and fundamentals: Software development (Python, other OOP or functional languages)Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure or GCP)Databases/Datawarehouses (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, Snowflake, or Redshift)
